Social Media Intern / Customer Service Support Personnel Job at House of Maryjane




        
    

        
        House of Maryjane is a unique brand that offers professional fashion designing services such as ready-to-wear, bespoke, wedding gowns, reception dresses and bridal.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Intern / Customer Service Support Personnel

Job Location: Festac, Lagos

Job Summary


	We are currently looking for competent and hard working Social media intern to handle all our social media platforms


Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Deliberate planning, strategy and goal setting
	Development of brand awareness and online reputation
	Content management (on all social media platforms)
	SEO (search engine optimization) and generation of inbound traffic
	Cultivation of leads and sales


Requirements


	Reputation management must be a highly motivated, creative individual with experience and a passion for connecting with current and future customers.
	Must be able to work under pressure
	Must be highly skilled,fast and efficient .
	Must be able to present, promote and sell products/services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers
	Must Perform cost-benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs
	Must be able to establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships
	Must be able to reach out to customer leads through cold calling
	Must be able to work without supervision
	Must be computer literate.
	Candidates should possess an SSCE / OND / HND / Bachelor's Degree with 4+ years of relevant work experience.
	Must have vast experience in Customer care.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: houseofmaryjane1@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For further inquiries, call: 08154113937.

Job Position: Direct Sales Agent
Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

  "description": "RevenStrat is a consultancy and advisory firm focused on helping both startups and established enterprises address their most challenging strategic issues. We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive / Marketer (High-Level)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Sales &amp; Marketing

Role Overview


	Lead strategic marketing and sales initiatives to drive customer acquisition and platform growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement marketing campaigns across digital and traditional channels.
	Manage and mentor mid-level marketers and sales staff.
	Analyse market trends and customer data to optimise campaigns.
	Collaborate with product and digital teams to align marketing with platform features.
	Drive revenue growth through targeted acquisition and retention strategies.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Customer acquisition and conversion rates.
	Campaign ROI and engagement.
	Team performance and goal achievement.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Marketing, Business or related field.
	5+ years in sales or marketing leadership roles.
	Experience with Nigerian digital consumer markets.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong leadership and communication.
	Strategic thinking and analytical skills.
	Proficiency with marketing platforms and tools.


Work Environment &amp; Culture:


	Hybrid office and field environment.


Career Progression:


	Senior Marketing Manager or Business Development Director.


Special Notes / Nigerian Market Context:


	Must understand Nigerian social media trends and consumer behaviour.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;humanresources@revenstrat.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Sales Executive / Marketer (High-Level) Job at RevenStrat Cnsulting




        
    

        
        RevenStrat is a consultancy and advisory firm focused on helping both startups and established enterprises address their most challenging strategic issues. Our team is committed to guiding clients through disruptive market changes, helping them steer clear of pivotal business errors that could jeopardize their success.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive / Marketer (High-Level)

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Sales & Marketing

Role Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Lead strategic marketing and sales initiatives to drive customer acquisition and platform growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement marketing campaigns across digital and traditional channels.
	Manage and mentor mid-level marketers and sales staff.
	Analyse market trends and customer data to optimise campaigns.
	Collaborate with product and digital teams to align marketing with platform features.
	Drive revenue growth through targeted acquisition and retention strategies.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Customer acquisition and conversion rates.
	Campaign ROI and engagement.
	Team performance and goal achievement.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business or related field.
	5+ years in sales or marketing leadership roles.
	Experience with Nigerian digital consumer markets.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong leadership and communication.
	Strategic thinking and analytical skills.
	Proficiency with marketing platforms and tools.


Work Environment & Culture:


	Hybrid office and field environment.


Career Progression:


	Senior Marketing Manager or Business Development Director.


Special Notes / Nigerian Market Context:


	Must understand Nigerian social media trends and consumer behaviour.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: humanresources@revenstrat.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: We appreciate all applications; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Mechanical Engineering Workshop Manager Job at Agbeyewa Farms




        
    

        
        Agbeyewa Farms is a world-class agribusiness with farm operations in Ekiti State, Nigeria. We have foresight for expansion into Africa whilst we create decent jobs and economic opportunities for local communities and become a force to reckon with in the agribusiness on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Mechanical Engineering Workshop Manager

Job Location: Ikere-Ekiti, Ekiti
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Oversee daily operations in the workshop, ensuring tools and equipment are maintained and used properly.
	Maintain an organized and safe working environment.
	Good knowledge of operating and maintaining various workshop machinery including tractors, harvesters, planters, irrigation systems, and processing equipment.
	Perform regular diagnostics and repair of agricultural machinery and equipment including tractors, bulldozers, harvesters, planters, and processing equipment.
	Use diagnostics tools and equipment to identify mechanical faults and determine appropriate repair methods.
	Develop and implement preventive maintenance schedules to ensure the longevity and reliability of all machinery and equipment.
	Identify opportunities to improve the efficiency and reliability of machinery and workshop processes.
	Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, repairs, and parts inventory. Prepare reports on equipment status and performance.
	Assist in the installation and commissioning of new machinery and equipment, ensuring they meet operational requirements.
	Ensure all activities in the workshop comply with health and safety regulations. Promote a safety-first culture.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.
	Experience: Minimum of 8 years of experience in a similar role within the agribusiness sector or a related industry.
	Proficiency in diagnosing and repairing agricultural machinery.
	Familiarity with hydraulic, pneumatic, and electrical systems.
	Knowledge of welding, fabrication, and machining processes.
	Competency in using computer-based maintenance management systems (CMMS).
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Good communication and leadership abilities.
	Attention to detail and commitment to quality.


Benefits


	Competitive Compensation.   
	5 - day workweek.    
	Flextime.   
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children).   
	Wellness Programs   
	Employee Training Programs   
	Growth and Development   
	Mentoring and Counseling.
